The voltage constants in the code are floats, instead 
of integers. Same with the 2.0 vs 2. Yes it does matter.
A and B represent the new interval that enclose the root.
The motor function has three roots.

I guessed 0-50,(-100)-(-50), and 50-100. 
The roots were 35.687256, -50.823975, 52.63015

The derivative of the function is
	0.06x^2-1.5x-52.2=f'(x)
You need it because the newton method uses the slope
to find the next guess.
The newton method finds 35.685610. Very close
For the 30 guess, it finds the same root as before

The number of iterations of bisections is higher than
the iterations for newton.
 
iter:0	x0:30.000000	x1:34.814815	err:4.814815
iter:1	x0:34.814815	x1:35.653164	err:0.838349
iter:2	x0:35.653164	x1:35.685560	err:0.032396
Newton returned root: 35.685610


iter:0	a:0.000000	b:50.000000	x:25.000000	err:25.000000
